Show / Hide Table of Contents

Class WorldSpawnSettings

World spawn builder settings. Any property not set will be ignored.

Any setting not set for a builder will mean Spawn That will use the existing setting when overriding a template, or set a default value if creating a new.

Intended as an optional way to configure IWorldSpawnBuilder.

Biomes

List of biomes in which template is active.

Empty list or null will be treated as if property was not set.

Default if new template: All biomes enabled

ConditionEnvironments

List of environments in which spawn is active.

Eg. "Clear", "Misty", "Heath clear".

Empty list or null will be treated as if property was not set.

Default if new template: No required environments

ConditionMaxTilt

Maximum tilt of terrain required to spawn. Range 0 to 90.

Position condition. Tested multiple times to decide where to spawn entity.

Note: As of this writing, the vanilla calculation is bugged. Be careful with this setting.

Default if new template: 35

| Improve this Doc View Source

MaxLevel

Maximum level to spawn at.

Level is assigned by rolling levelup-chance for each level from min, until max is reached.

This means if levelup chance is 10 (default), there is 10% chance for a MinLevel 1 to become level 2, and 1% chance to become level 3.

Default if new template: 1

Declaration
public int? MaxLevel { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Nullable<System.Int32>
Remarks

Vanilla name: m_maxLevel

| Improve this Doc View Source

MaxSpawned

Maxium number of same entity in area for template to be active.

For creatures, area is defined by currently loaded. For non-creatures, it is defined by distance.

Default if new template: 1

PackSpawnCircleRadius

Radius of circle, in which to spawn a pack of entities.

Eg., when pack size is 3, all 3 spawns will happen inside a circle indicated by this radius.

SpawnAtDistanceToPlayerMax

Maximum distance from player to spawn at.

A specific player is chosen as a target, this setting with min basically creates a ring around the player, in which a spawn point can be chosen.

Valheim treats 0 as 80.

Default if new template: 0

Declaration
public float? SpawnAtDistanceToPlayerMax { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Nullable<System.Single>
Remarks

Vanilla name: m_spawnRadiusMax

| Improve this Doc View Source

A specific player is chosen as a target, this setting with max basically creates a ring around the player, in which a spawn point can be chosen.

Valheim treats 0 as 40.

Note: If not true, creatures with MonsterAI will attempt to despawn at day.
